snippet: New York State Police troopers converged on Saturday on a spot near Friendship, N.Y., in the southwestern part of the state, where they believed a resident had caught sight of the men.
abstract: Witness claims to have glimpsed escaped killers David Sweat and Richard Matt near Friendship, NY, drawing law enforcement to area; development appears to have brought investigators closer to finding convicts.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and LIAM STACK
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael Regan from Friendship, N.Y., Michael Schwirtz and Michael Winerip from Plattsburgh, N.Y., Jesse McKinley from Albany, and Joshua Jamerson, William K. Rashbaum from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: New York State Police troopers converged on Saturday on a spot near Friendship, N.Y., in the southwestern part of the state, where they believed a resident had caught sight of the men.

headline.main: ‘Significant Sighting’ of 2 Killers Who Escaped From Prison, Police Say
headline.print_headline: ‘Significant Sighting’ of 2 Killers Who Escaped From Prison, Police Say
